title: Production (economics)
summary: Production is the process of combining various material inputs and immaterial inputs (plans, know-how) in order to make something for consumption (output). It is the act of creating an output, a good or service which has value and contributes to the utility of individuals.[1] The area of economics that focuses on production is referred to as production theory, which is intertwined with the consumption (or consumer) theory of economics.[2]
